title: Distribution of difference in rolls of two dice

content.question: For a roll of a fair die, each of the outcomes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 is equally likely. A red die and a green die are rolled simultaneously, and the difference of the outcomes (red â€“ green) is computed. This is repeated for a total of 500 rolls of the pair of dice. Which of the following graphs best represents the most reasonable distribution of the differences?

choices.label: Choice A is a bar graph. Choice A has a vertical axis that goes from 0 to 120 in increments of 20 and a horizontal axis that goes from 0 to 8 in increments of 1, and bars of width 1. The six bars are all around the same height of 80.

Choice B is a bar graph. Choice B has a vertical axis that goes from 0 to 80 in increments of 20 and a horizontal axis that goes from 0 to 14 in increments of 2, and bars of width approximately two thirds. The eleven bars start out short on the left at 2, have a peak in the middle at 7, and are short again on the right at 12.

Choice C is a bar graph. Choice C has a vertical axis that goes from 0 to 80 in increments of 20 and a horizontal axis that goes from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 2, and bars of width 1. The eleven bars start out short on the left at negative 5, have a peak in the middle at 0, and are short again on the right at 5.

Choice D is a bar graph. Choice D has a vertical axis that goes from 0 to 60 in increments of 10 and a horizontal axis that goes from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 2, and bars of width 1. The eleven bars are all about the same height of 50.

Choice E is a bar graph. Choice E has a vertical axis that goes from 0 to 140 in increments of 20 and a horizontal axis that goes from 0 to 6 in increments of 2, and bars of width approximately two thirds. The seven bars have heights from left to right of approximately 70, 110, 130, 40, 40, 20, and 30.

content.answer: Choice C is a bar graph. Choice C has a vertical axis that goes from 0 to 80 in increments of 20 and a horizontal axis that goes from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 2, and bars of width 1. The eleven bars start out short on the left at negative 5, have a peak in the middle at 0, and are short again on the right at 5.
